segments.pli: Atha kho aññataro bhikkhu yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami … pe … ekamantaṃ nisinno kho so bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha … and asked him,
“Sir, they speak of someone who is ‘accomplished regarding the faculties’.

segments.pli: Kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, indriyasampanno hotī”ti?
segments.en: How is someone accomplished regarding the faculties defined?”

segments.pli: “Cakkhundriye ce, bhikkhu, udayabbayānupassī viharanto cakkhundriye nibbindati … pe …
segments.en: “Mendicant, if someone meditates observing rise and fall in the eye faculty, they grow disillusioned with the eye faculty.

segments.pli: jivhindriye ce, bhikkhu, udayabbayānupassī viharanto jivhindriye nibbindati … pe …
segments.en: If they meditate observing rise and fall in the ear faculty … nose faculty … tongue faculty … body faculty …

segments.pli: manindriye ce, bhikkhu, udayabbayānupassī viharanto manindriye nibbindati.
segments.en: mind faculty, they grow disillusioned with the mind faculty.

segments.pli: Nibbindaṃ virajjati … pe … vimuttasmiṃ vimuttamiti ñāṇaṃ hoti.
segments.en: Being disillusioned, desire fades away. … When they’re freed, they know they’re freed.

segments.pli: ‘Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti pajānāti.
segments.en: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’
This is how someone who is accomplished regarding the faculties is defined.”

sections.title: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha ……

suttaplex.blurb: One is accomplished in the sense faculties by being freed from attachment to them.
